short_summary: Modify existing range towers used to guide vessels
description: Perform a geotechnical investigation, obtain engineered foundation, demolish existing towers, and install new towers
duration_in_months: When the dcument is Ok i am looking for the tender
full_summary:
### Modified Fixed Aid Presqu’ile Bay - Tender Notice
#### Public Works and Government Services Canada

**Project Overview**
The Canadian Coast Guard requires modification services to the pair of existing front and rear range towers in Presqu’ile Bay, facilitating safe navigation for commercial and recreational vessels entering the bay from Lake Ontario.

**Scope of Work**
The successful proponent will be responsible for performing a geotechnical investigation at the current front range tower location, including design engineering of a new tower foundation to support sector light installation. Additionally, the contractor will demolish the existing rear range tower and perform demolition of the existing front range tower, both located in public areas with lead-based paint.

**Bid Requirements**
Submissions must be made electronically through Shared Services Canada’s Buy and Sell website. All inquiries must be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority by May 15, 2024 at the latest.

**Tender Details**
* **Reference Number:** cb-81-97004794
* **Amendment Number:** 2
* **Solicitation Number:** 30004583
* **Publication Date:** April 11, 2024
* **Tender Closing Date:** May 2, 2024 at 14:00 ET
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** May 24, 2024
* **Expected Contract End Date:** November 29, 2024

**Additional Information**
A Notice of Proposed Procurement (NPP) has been posted on MERX. The bid document package, including the Solicitation Document, can be downloaded from the Buy and Sell website.

Please note that the bid deadline is May 2, 2024, at 14:00 ET. All bids must be submitted electronically.

If you have any questions or concerns, please email the Contracting Authority at [paul.fortier@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:paul.fortier@dfo-mpo.gc.ca) or call (343) 596-9926.
#### Contact Information
[Paul Fortier](mailto:paul.fortier@dfo-mpo.gc.ca)
(343) 596-9926
FISHERIES AND OCEANS CANADA
200 Kent Street, Ottawa, ON K1A 0E6
